alert.note: Alert for Blount Smoky Mountains; Loudon; NW Blount; North Sevier; Northwest Monroe; Sevier Smoky Mountains; Southeast Monroe (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 1:56AM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Cherokee, southeastern Loudon, Blount, northeastern Monroe and Sevier Counties through 330 AM EDT... At 256 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Gatlinburg to 8 miles northwest of Smoky Mountains-Twentymile Creek to near Loudon. Movement was southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Maryville, Sevierville, Alcoa, Loudon, Gatlinburg, Pigeon Forge, Louisville, Rockford, Eagleton Village and Smoky Mountains-Newfound Gap. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM EDT for east Tennessee.

area.areaDesc: Blount Smoky Mountains; Loudon; NW Blount; North Sevier; Northwest Monroe; Sevier Smoky Mountains; Southeast Monroe
